author: kfogel
msg: It's safe to ignore a DB_INCOMPLETE error from dbenv->txn_checkpoint().
Thanks to Sander Striker for doing the legwork to discover this.
* subversion/libsvn_fs/trail.c
(commit_trail): Tolerate DB_INCOMPLETE when checkpointing.

author: kfogel
msg: With Mike and Ben, invoke the new read authorization callback in
svn_repos_dir_delta, and call the editor->absent_foo functions instead
of editor->add_foo or editor->open_foo if the authz check fails.
* subversion/libsvn_repos/delta.c
(struct context): Add new fields authz_read_func, authz_read_baton.
(authz_root_check): New helper func.
(svn_repos_dir_delta): Set the new fields in the context.  Call
authz_root_error before editor->open_root calls.  Do authz checks
before other editor helpers, and shunt to absentification helper
if the checks fail.
(delta_dirs): Do authz checks before editor helper calls, shunt to
absentification helper if the checks fail.
(absent_file_or_dir): New helper func.

author: cmpilato
msg: * subversion/include/svn_md5.h
(svn_md5_empty_string_digest): Fix space-before-paren.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/md5.c
(svn_md5_empty_string_digest): Add 'void' to the empty param list.
Dunno if this is required, but don't it look purty?

author: kfogel
msg: Formatting tweak, follows up to revision 7585:
* subversion/libsvn_fs/fs.c
(svn_fs__clean_logs): Put 'static' on same line as return type.

author: philip
msg: Don't use DB_PRIVATE when shared repository access is required.
Doing so meant that the svnadmin commands list-dblogs,
list-unused-dblogs and hotcopy could hang a repository if some
other process was accessing it at the same time.
* subversion/libsvn_fs/fs.c
(svn_fs_berkeley_logfiles): Don't use DB_PRIVATE.
